item.title: 2 green wheelies and rubbish, 30th December
item.description:
One green wheelie filled with garden waste has been there for several weeks, it's now been joined by another, together with some household waste. It seems the area is becoming a dumping ground. What is wrong with people?☹️
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Yeend Close, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned trolley, 30th December
item.description:
Trolley has been here for several days. I had an auto response from TBC saying that it wasn't in their area, I'm aware of that - normally FMS sends direct to CBC, so not sure why it was sent to TBC this time. Either way the trolley is still there...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Yeend Close, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on bend - junction of Birdlip Road & Aggs Hill, 30th December
item.description:
I recently reported a number of potholes and was informed that they had been fixed (enquiry number 22034889), however the worst/deepest one has not been fixed - see photos taken earlier this pm. It is so deep it goes through a number of layers of road. Because it is situated on the bend it is not visible to traffic until the last second and looks deep enough to damage a wheel. It seems to me that it was not repaired when it should have been under enquiry 22034889?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole / sagging in pavement, 30th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Ewlyn Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Loss of surface tarmac in large areas, 30th December
item.description:
Almost full length of road. Loss of tarmac and driving on broken up road and gravel. Causing wheel spins even when driving at a few mph when driving reversing off driveways

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Grass verge was recently dug up mounds of dirt left, 30th December
item.description:
Location is outside Eastnor house princess Elizabeth way Cheltenham. Unable to cross grass verge to get to parked car without being ankle deep in mud especially when it’s rained. Even paths are covered in mud and kerb side is also clogged with leaves growing weeds and water. Not enough parking for 5 sets of flats some having to park on grass which also adds to the problem. Also path a bit further up from parking area is all broken and a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain in wrong position to stop severe flooding, 30th December
item.description:
A drain positioned on the right hand side of the entrance (facing into the Close) of Swindon Close, close to the junction of Swindon Road needs to be moved down into Swindon Road. In it's present position the water running off Swindon Close bypasses the drain and collects in the road with the flow of water running Se to NW. Even with moderate rainfall the water can rise to kerb level and causes a major problem to pedestrians walking on the south side of the footpath. I have witnessed many occasions when pedestrians have been sprayed with water by vehicles driving past. This situation has now been in place since early 2000.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37-40, Swindon Close, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
